v_stitch double_crochet 24 v_stitch double_crochet 34 v_stitch double_crochet 24 v_stitch double_crochet 17 slip_stitch to first st 124 now you will create armholes by skipping the side sections and crocheting into the v stitches to connect the wider sections ie front/back you may chain stitches between the v stitches for a looser arm hole but follow along for a snug fit double_crochet 18 v_stitch skip 24 sts v_stitch double_crochet 36 v_stitch skip 24 sts v_stitch double_crochet 18 80 double_crochet 19 2 double_crochet into chain 2 space double_crochet into next two sts 2 double_crochet into chain 2 space double_crochet 38 2 double_crochet into chain 2 space double_crochet into next two sts 2 double_crochet into chain 2 space double_crochet 19 88 double_crochet around 88 we re going to decrease every other row from here to get a tapered shape because i want the body to fit snug but if you like you can continue straight until it s long enough double_crochet 9 decrease around 80 double_crochet around 80 double_crochet 8 decrease around 72 double_crochet around 72 double_crochet 7 double_crochet 2tog around 64 double_crochet around 64 optional single_crochet or half_double_crochet around for a clean finish fasten_off weave in the tail and you re done
